text: Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Potężna, charakterna, waniliowo-kokosowa beczka, syrop klonowy, kawa, paloność. Oleiste, słodkie. Pyszne.
Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017, red session. Aroma has brown sugar, toffee and whiskey. Taste follows sweet with caramel, fudge, really faint maple but nice bourbon flavor.
Sample @ MBCC 2017, Red session. Weak black pour with a small head. Notes of maple, lots of maple, some roast, light vanilla and some toffee.
Tap @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration, 2017. Pours black with a creamy off white head. Maple, coffee, bourbon and vanilla. Slick and oily. Tasty sipper!
Keg at cbc17 Red.. Mdark black... Thin tan lacing... Soft sweet chocolate roast malts nose.. Heavy sweet malts... Loads of bourbon.. Mostly bourbon
Sampled at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Dark brown pour with a tan head. Notes of bourbon, oak and a lot of woody notes. A bit boozy and not much maple.

13-MAY-2017, draft @MBCC 2017, with Ulkløbben.
Dark, dark Brown with no head.
Aroma is mostly Bourbon - nice :-)
Taset is Bourbon, Maple, chocolate. Full, very Little carbonation.

Tap @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017   Syrop klonowy w aromacie. W smaku trochę mniej. Pełne, czekoladowe, karmelowe z akcentami ciemnego chleba, lekkiego toffi. melanoidy, toffi. Minimalna paloność w tle. 
Beczka delikatnie zaznaczone, nie jest jakaś dominująca.
Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Red Session. Dunkel braune Farbe. Geruch nach Kaffee, bourbon, reifes Obst. Geschmack ist sehr schokoladig, süß röstmalzig, bourbon top.

duft: karamel chokolade ristet malt kaffe chokolade
smag chokolade kaffe rist karamel lidt brun sukker
Tap @ MBC 2017. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of maple, choko, licorice, toffee, sweet caramel with loads of maple. heavy sweet, choko toffe, maple, slight wood, with some good barrel.

0,05l from tap shared by / with the crew during mbcc red session. black color, small coffee colored head. smells of wood, bourbon, molasses, light cinnamon, coconut, some bitter chocolate. very nice smell. full body, no carbonation, very nice oily mouthfeel. tastes of molasses, wood, some bourbon, bitter chocolate, licorice, coconut, light cinnamon. finishes lightly sweet with notes of bourbon, coconut and some bitter chocolate. very very nice beer, smell was not that out of the ordinary, but taste is very smooth and very nicely balance. overall very nice and smooth barrel aged impy stout.

8, 4, 9, 5, 18

13.05.2017, tap @ MBCC:
Nice slightly bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet mineraly, dark sugar, minerals, oak, bourbon, maple syrup, caramel, bark, grass, chocolate, hay, toffee, nuts. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish roasted, dark malts, weeds, oak, minerals, bourbon, chocolate pudding, booze, toast, hay, bark, cocoa, maple syrup, dark sugar. Medium bitterness, dry roasted mouthfeel. Nice.

Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of chocolate, caramel, muscovado sugar, vanilla. Taste is chocolatey and roasted with vanilla and bourbon notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation with moderate carbonation

Pours dark with low tanned head 
Aromas of bourbon, vanilla, milk chocolate, dark fruits, muscavado 
Taste has notes of bourbon, vanilla, milk chocolate, cacao nibs, muscavado,
Provsmak på MBCC 2017. Svart med lite beige skum. Söt doft av choklad. Söt och trevlig.
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon. Taste is rich bourbon, maple, sweet and fiery finish. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation.

Tap at MBCC 2017. Pours black with almost no head. Oak, bourbon, coffee, chocolate, berries. Balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Brus.
Pitch black colored with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel, dried fruits, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla and licorice.
Sweet and roasted flavor of chocolate, bourbon and alcohol.
Roasted finish.

Draft. A black beer with a brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate, roasted malt, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of prunes, roasted malt, chocolate, and alcohol, leading to a dry roasted finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - Black pour with beige head. Sweet and light roasted malty aroma and taste, some chocolate and caramel and toffee notes, some sticky sweet maple, bourbon soaked wooden accents into the finish. Lovely.
From tap. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty, dense vanilla and caramelish. Sweet, toasted malty, caramelish and roasted malty. Sweet and toasted, caramelish finish.

Bottle in Seattle. Thanks Chris! No head, Rich heavy dark brown sweet boozy nose. Rich, distant maple sweetness with an equal bitter, earthy grain. A bit earthy and sharp, certainly a porter underneath all of this. Sweet, dark vanilla edge, rising bourbon flavor. Sweet dark malt, not cloying. Rich but I wouldnt guess this was 11%. A nice treat.

375 mL bottle poured, with much thanks to Matt, (and Chris) for the bottle. A dark cola, reddish brown pour with almost no head. A strong, nutty, boozy bourbon chocolate aroma. Flavor is exceptionally smooth vanilla bourbon, and cocoa constant. Rich chocolate flavor, with a long lingering maple syrup constant. Very true to that flavor, which is incredibly nice. Doesnt give off the overly heavy impressions of an 11% beer by any means. Smooth, and extremely flavorful. Very nicely done.
Dark brown off white head. Oak, vanilla, caramel. Not overly sweet. Adjectives

@Ulfborg Scooper. Black, creamy beige head. Aroma has soft bourbon and wood. Maple syryp and bourbon flavour, boozy, warming. Starts out big but finishes rather quickl, leaving just the sweet, hot alc burn.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, bourbon, fruits, wood, citrus, chocolate and has a sour bourbon finish. The sourness is not optimal here unfortunately.

Bottle, 11%. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, maple, little coffee and a little bourbon. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, maple, little bourbon, sweet, warming, notes of alcohol, notes of sourness,

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, maple syrup and light bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet, rather bitter and light acidic. Dry, rather bitter and light acidic finish. The maple syrup doesnt do any good here. 040317

Bottle. Pours thin. Not much carbonated head. The aroma is great. Maple, vanilla, bourbon. Palate is creamy and thin. The taste is sweet maple vanilla chocolate and bourbon. Nice wooden oak taste. Awesome beer.

Bottle thanks to Ray, thank you! Pour is dark; nearly black with a small tan head. Not as thick as expected. Aroma is straight forward: sweet chocolate malt, vanilla, light toffee, and distant booze maple. Flavor is sweet maple and vanilla malt up front with more sweet malt and toffee to follow. Sweet with maple and vanilla. Not much alcohol. A little light on body, but solid overall.

Bottle thanks to alwcordell. Pours clear black, small tan head, dissipates fairly quickly, some lacing. Aroma is maple, cocoa, bourbon. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, really light on maple overall. Light body.

12.7 ounce bottle. Pours black with a smallish brown head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, and bourbon. Taste is chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, roasted malt, coffee, and maple syrup. Fairly thick and creamy. Delicious.

Bottle, shared by Roger (thanks!). Earlier batch. Dark pour, small head. Aroma brings chocolate, marshmallow, molasses and vanilla. Sweet, chocolatey, and rich. Full body, smooth texture, soft carb. Overall: one tasty brew.

Thanks Matthew. Dark brown body with a thin, tan collar. Aromas of chocolate, vanilla, oak, ripe dark fruits. Some tannic notes in the flavor, with bourbon and a prevalent sweetness imparted from the maple. Light-medium in body with soft carbonation. Mild warming alcohol in the finish. Nice.

bottle poured into a snifter..dark brown with a thin beige head..aroma of maple syrup,bourbon,roasted nuts,chocolate coffee..tastes of all the previous
but just didnt hit me like their other BA stuff..still good..but was disappointed.
Bottle - pours dark brown tan head - nose/taste of maple syrup, bourbon, dark chocolate, oak, molasses, brown sugar and vanilla - full bodied.

375ml bottle and on tap at ratebeer best festival. pours out black topped with a tan head. nose is big sweetness maple syrup molasses coffee chocolate bourbon barrel vanilla. Taste is more of the big sweetness bourbon barrel vanilla brown sugar molasses chocolate maple syrup. This was great.

Pours a dark brown color, with a small, soon disappearing dark brown lacing.

Offers a plethora of flavors, mainly coconut, caramel coated vanilla and sweet maple syrup, balanced by earthy malts and bakers chocolate. 

Low on its carbonation, with a thinner mouthfeel to it, gently balancing the Bourbon with a silk layer of cream.

Tastes of milk chocolate, cloying molasses, cocoa nibs and earth. Bourbon, soothed by cream, becomes apparent by a dry coconut alcohol bite, revealing bitter chocolate and rock sugar. Finishes with caramel and a slightly bittercoffee earthiness, featuring a pleasant, sugar coated dryness.

Relying heavily on the barrel, this reveals a lot of awesome Bourbon characteristics among sweeter malts, balanced by a bitter dryness. A little thin as for its mouthfeel, while providing a great creaminess.
Bottle shared at Jasons. Maple. Dark bourbon. Some sticky. Big and boozy. Nice.

Bottle. Poured a deep dark brown with a small bubbly tan head. Aromas of bourbon, vanilla, maple, caramel, and chocolate. Flavor had bourbon in the front, but mellowed as it warmed. Then more of the maple, vanilla, and chocolate notes came out. Full body, oily texture, average carbonation, warming alcohol burn to finish.

February 13, 2016. Bottle, shared by linusb, thanks! 
Black with a very small tan head. Aroma is bourbon, some greenish notes, vanilla, some chocolate notes, hints of vanilla, caramel. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter, slight warming alcohol. Finish is sweet caramel, vanilla, some warming bourbon notes, bitter dark chocolate notes, light coffee. Medium bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation.
A: Pitch black, thin nougat head lacing N: Vanilla, bourbon, almond, alcohol T: Vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, maple, almond O: Very nice with a warming alcohol finish.
[1/31/16] Draught sample at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Black. Chocolate, cookies, cake, vanilla, bourbon, sweet. Thick, viscous, rounded. Great.
Tap at the Rate Beer Awards Festival. Huge nose of maple syrup, chocolate, vanilla. Sweet flavor of chocolate, maple syrup, bourbon, vanilla. Smooth and silky, almost flat but luscious.
Draft - Bourbon, sweet dark chocolate and graham cracker. Jet black with a decent light brown head. Sweet bourbon, bit of heat and not much else.
Dark black. Lots of bourbon, but not horribly boozy. Maple is a nice subtle touch. Sweet at first, then rounds out to familiar bourbon barrel woodiness. Vanilla? Really delicious.

Bottle courtesy of goryshkewych. Cheers, George! Pours a deeper than brown ale but not quite stout brown with a tan head. Nose is toasted malts, oak, barrel, maple, bourbon, and some mild vanilla. Flavor is bourbon, malt, vanilla, maple, oak, and some mild booze. A very smooth blending of flavors with some booze and some bourbon into the finish. Medium in body and very nice overall.

375 ml bottle, my 100th rated Imperial Porter! Dark brown with a trace of foam. Nose is chocolate cake, bourbon, vanilla, dates and woody coconut. Medium body with soft carb. Quite rich. Taste is molasses, dark chocolate and bourbon finishing with delicious hints of maple.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2015 375 mL bottled 2014, drunk 11/28/15.Medium opacity, with a quickly fading tan head.Rich toffee, milk chocolate, light maple and very relaxed bourbon in the nose is highly aromatic and covers up all the alcohol, which is impressive. Light vanilla, a touch of soy and a bit of ash on the end.Rich toffee, salted caramel, toasted oak and very soft coconut give way to a bit of ash and roast. Lightly, but tightly carbonated, with some peanut brittle and a touch of bready oxidation. No alcohol whatsoever. Very drinkable and rich without being too sweet. Maybe a bit more soy and toasted oak but otherwise fantastic.

375 ml bottle thanks to Willrunforbeer! 2014 vintage... Dude, pimping! Pitch black in color with thin white head around the sample. Aroma is is rich and dark and decadent; full of maple sugar, bourbon notes, molasses, pumpernickel bread. Wow this is rich! 
Flavor is just as rich, with a low bourbon character yet full of maple, oak, pumpernickel bread and chewy for a porter. Rich without being to sweet. Oily/ almost slick texture. Well it is VERY sweet but still very drinkable. Nice.

Chriss extravaganza. 375ml 2014 bottle from a trade I cant remember. Pours thick dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is molasses, dark chocolate, maple, bourbon, oak. Smells great. Flavor is molasses, dark chocolate, maple. A hint of the bourbon barrel in the finish. A little thinner in the mouth than it looks in the glass.
Rate #1700 with the "My Indian Name is: RunsWithBeer" pic in the video. Sweet!

Thanks, WillRunForBeer. Dark dark dark brown in color with minimal, non-lingering white head. Smell is maple syrup and dark chocolate. Flavor is perfect bourbon porter. Some booze at the end. Some sweetness from the syrup. Overall, this is awesome.

Poured from bottle dsted 2014 thanks Willrunforbeer pours black with a small beige head. Aroma is awesome and complex with notes maple bourbon and cocoa. Taste is smooth and very well balanced with nice alcohol in the finish. There is a slight burnt note in the very end.

Pitch black, thanks WillRun! This is completely oily, no head. 375ML bottle. Smells stupid good. This brewery can make some Imperial Stouts! This just smells like a fountain made of fudge out of bourbon barrel staves. tootsie roll, chocolate milk and vanilla beans. Unfortunately, the taste is way less than te taste. some chocolate, lots of burnt overly roasted coffee beans and no maple with a boozy finish. Good oily mouthfeel but thins out to watered down coffee at the end.

375mL bottle, pours black with a small beige head. Aroma is complex, with notes of maple syrup, bourbon barrels, and some cocoa. Flavour is rich, with maple syrup and bourbon barrels in wonderful cohesion - not too sweet or boozy. Complex and elegant. Excellent.

Refrigerated 12.7 brown bottle poured into a glass. Black with small beige head. Aroma is bourbon, medium body, lower carbonation, and pretty good small-bubble lacing. Taste is maple, bourbon, toasty, some wood, some booze, and hints of vanilla.

375 ml bottle to snifter (2015 vintage, shared by DrSilverworm). Looks good; a slightly translucent dark cola with beige head that quickly dissipates into thin lacing. Smells of dark malt, oak, and mildly notes of maple syrup and bourbon. Tastes like it smells, but richer and more balanced, with a somewhat boozy medium full-bodied mouthfeel. Enjoyable.

375ml bottle pours a murky black with some fluffy, white head. Nose has caramel, nougat, molasses, light maple syrup, some dark chocolate, light booze. Flavor has more vanilla, maple, some birch too, molasses, something a little vegetal, light char Full bodied, slick, oily and a bit sweet on the finish.

Shared at a bottle share, hosted by Mickey before the U-of-M game on October 10. Poured from a 375 mL bottle. The pour is a nice black, thick and oily, with a small ring of dark khaki colored head that lasted the entire time. The aroma on this is pretty heavy on the bourbon. There is a brown sugar sweetness that accompanies some light molasses as well. Chocolate is also present with a nice roasty malt and some light vanilla. I wanted this one to have a lot more maple to it than it had. The flavor is very similar. There is a nice bourbon heat up front again, and this time there is a light maple present, but some of the other flavors suffer. There is a nice chocolate, some oak, and maybe a touch of vanilla. The booziness kind of dominates the back end. The mouth feel is viscous and oily. Nice and thick with a great soft carbonation and a lingeringly boozy, lightly sweet aftertaste. This was surprisingly good, but it needed some more maple.

Enjoyed on tap at Winking Lizard on October 23, 2015.

Look - Definitely black, not brown. Nice off white head even for a bar pour. Stayed around with a ring. Not a lot of lacing.

Smell - Maple. Coffee. Chocolate. No vanilla/pancakes as CBS had.

Taste - Maple but not terribly over done. Chocolate. Coffee. Vanilla comes through in taste. Bourbon.

Feel - Very smooth for 11%. Doesnt really burn tongue or throat at all. Creamy.

Overall - Better than CBS. More maple as opposed to pancakes. Smooth.
Bottle share at kickbacks. Pours an inky black. No real head. Aromas of bourbon and vanilla and dark fruits. Pretty sweet taste with alcohol head. Solid.

Bottle shared by Dirty Johnny at the Galaxy. Thanks! The pour was deep brown with very small head. The aroma was chocolate, maple, doughnut, brown sugars, oak barrel, booze. Taste was similar with the maple and chocolate prominant, then the sugars and bread dough or doughtnut, then the oak barrel and booze on the end. Didnt seem like 11% though. Medium body, medium carb. Finish is a nice balance of flavors and barrel.

Pours black with a brown sugar colored foam head that dissipates quickly, leaving only a fine ring of foam that hugged my glass. The aroma is of bourbon, sweet sugary maple, some chocolate, mild oak, carmel, minor smokey scent, a hint of vanilla, and possibly a touch of hazelnut. A rather complex aroma. Tasting, I noticed a thin to medium body. There is definitely a good maple taste. I also picked up on a mild bourbon flavor. The aroma compliments the flavor rather well. The finish is very pleasant with a nice bitterness. Overall a well done brew. Definitely worth a try.
Bottle. 375 (or 12oz?) Little barrel. Lots of dark malt. Medium sweetness. Slight maple. Feels lighter than 11%.
Small format bottle. Deep brown color. One of my favorite Jackie Os bottles but not quite up to Maman! Full+ body and medium- carbonation.

Bottle: Poured a caramel black and tan color head. Aroma is big boozy with candy maple sugar. Taste is loaded bourbon that works well with the maple syrup and candy toffee, and just enough caramel malt to ensure its not cloying sweet.

Bottle shared at the Tropical Croydonia tasting. 01/07/2015. Many thanks to Mr Bois. Black / mahogany borwn , viscous pour with a light tan head. Aroma is robust rich black coffee, coconut, salty. A bit harsh on the nose. Flavour is composed of salty, soy, bourbon booze, coocnut, roast, salty umami, maple and some apple. Palate is sweet and moderate carbonation, sticky, full body. Not a fan.

Bottle split at Scopesters on melt day, from an IP trade, 01/07/15.
Black with a decent tan covering that dissipates to the edge.
Nose is rich malt, chocolate, maple syrup, sweet toffee, light charr, figgy jam, bourbon trace.
Taste comprises sweet licks, chocolate, toffee fudge, maple syrup, light spice, roasty.
Full bodied, oily feel, sweet licks and warming booze in the close.
Decent.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle @ home which I believe was sent to me by my pal Brad in Ohio. Thanks Brad! Pours a black appearance with a thin brown head. The aroma is pretty potent- smoky meats, bacon, maple syrup, dark chocolate, and really strong whiskey. Moderate low carbonation but thats ok. Some signs of age with a bit of oxidation. Quite boozy with a burning finish. The flavor is fine- maple, toffee, caramel, tons of whiskey, and some smokiness. This is a sipper and should be shared but its fairly enjoyable.
2014 bottle. Aroma of walnuts, bourbon and roasted malts. Killer beer. Maybe the best beer from Ohio. Bourbon, roasted malts, oak, vanilla and deez nuts. Killer BA beer. Sweet, subtle maple syrup.

Bottle share at Pauls, many thanks to Colin for this one. 2014 vintage, 11% boost. Black, small foamy tan head. Aroma is molasses, sherry, oxidised, meaty and bovril-like. Body is medium, oily, smooth. Taste is similar to the aroma - stupidly sweet with vanilla bourbon, maple, aged sherry and bovril. Big, sweet and oily. OK, just not my sort of thing.

Bottle at the Croydonia tasting. It pours black with a decent tan head. The nose is soft, rich roast, juicy, fudge, vanilla, toasty marshmallow, rocky road and candy. The taste is rich, slick, rocky road, tar, fudge, candy, chocolate gateaux, toasty sugars, bourbon, vanilla ice-cream, crazy sweetness and sugar with a sweet, oily finish. Medium-full body and fine carbonation. Stick mouth-feel. Slick, rich and sweet. Perhaps too sweet, otherwise not bad.

bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks
Lovely bourbon aroma. Tan head which disspears quickly. Clear deep burgundy pour. Lovely bourbon notes. Well blalanced

Bottle shared. Pours very dark brown with a short lived beige head. Aroma of big bourbon, oak, chocolate, malt, molasses, light licorice, a little raisin, vanilla and light roast. Flavour is heavy sweet. Moderate thick oily mouthfeel with very light prickly carbonation and a full body. Lovely.

1st July 2015Tropical Croydonia Bottleshare. Thanks to Colin. Almost clear dark brown beer, thin tan head. Palate is light and a little soft. Very modest fine carbonation. Smooth dark chocolate malts. Well integrated spicy bourbon. Modest dark fruits. There is a touch of discernable maple which lifts the beer. Dry spicy finish.

22/VI/15 - 37.5cl bottle @ home - BB: n/a, 2014 vintage (2015-809)  Thanks to JefVerstraete for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown to purple beer, small aery beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet, vanilla, earthy notes, burnt malts, caramel, molasses, sugary. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet sugary start, caramel, maple syrup or molasses, spicy, cinnamon touch, not too much though, little bitter. Aftertaste: slightly sour, sugary, vanilla, lots of vanilla! Bourbon, bit boozy, milk chocolate. Lovely beer!

Bottle @ Croydonia. Deep brown with a small head. Nose of strong caramel dessert tipping. Chocolate. So sweet right now. Taste is very sweet. Caramel and chocolate. Toast. Frappucino. Full body, oily.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Cloin. Pours black-brown with a slight, creamy tan head. Serious dark malt nose, gooey chocolate, raisins. Medium to hearty sweet flavor with suggestions of oxidation, sugary toffee, bread, dark fruits, figs, raisins, mild earthy bitterness. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. Warming and oily on the finish, some dark chocolate, more ripe dark fruits, suggestions of maple syrup. Good stuff.
Bottle from a trade. Many thanks! Dark brown/black colour, beige foam. Soft carbonation. Sweet nose of maple, caramel, sweet chocolate, vanilla and lots of bourbon. Very sweet, a bit out of balance.

On tap at the pub. Pour is black with a tight tan head that never leaves. Nose is rich, a good bit of bourbon up front, sweet, tons of maple, malts dont shine through as much as you would hope but nose is powerful and didnt smell overly sugary. A good bit of toffee and some melted caramel. Taste is solid, lots of rich bourbon and maple, malts are more present, definitely sweet but seems fairly well attenuated. The style is going to breed a sweeter beer. Malts are rich, caramel and chocolate, body thins a bit in the finish, carb is very gentle. Soft feel and very creamy.

Bottle from a trade with alexsdad06. Pours dark brown / black with ruby red highlights and a tan head. Aromas of bourbon and roasted malts with some chocolate. Big bourbon and oak flavors with roasted malt and sweet chocolate. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. Excellent! Thanks Brad.

Bottle. Pours a deep mahogany, nearly but not quite black, with just a centimeter of burnt caramel head that fades quickly to a small ring of lacing. Aroma is very rich and complex with vintage bourbon, caramel, brandy, port, raisin, maple sugar, figs, bitter chocolate, mild boozy heat, and oak. Seems more in the old ale/barleywine category to me as opposed to imperial porter/stout. Taste unfortunately does not quite live up to the nose, with bourbon, caramel, raisin, and chocolate-covered cherry giving way to red licorice, ash, prune juice, sugar syrup, and sherry. A fairly light and thin mouthfeel  lighter and thinner than desirable  puts this in the porter camp. Very good but not great, aroma is the best part.

This beer pours pitch black with a medium thin beige head that diminishes steadily to a film. Strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of oak, roast malt and vanilla. Full-bodied with flavors of oaky bourbon, vanilla, charred malt and sweet caramel and maple. The finish is boozy with a bourbon and malt aftertaste. Enjoyable beer all around.

Bottle. Jet black and oily pour with a small mocha head. Barrel profile is present throughout but not overwhelming. Lots of roasted malt, maple, vanilla and dark fruit. Smooth and substantial mouthfeel. Excellent.

Bottle: Oily, fully black pour with a semi-creamy, mocha java head that settles to a thick collar. Huge maple, chocolate, & bourbon aroma. Smells like a maple oatmeal cookie dipped in booze. Brown sugar, caramel, & faint vanilla, too. Heavy bourbon flavor, dense fudge cake drizzled in maple, light oak, coconut, dark prune, & burnt brown sugar. Lingers with bourbon maple syrup, dark chocolate candy bar, & light licorice. Medium-heavy bodied. Great.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a Spiegelau tulip. No freshness date printed on label. 2014 bottling.

Appearance: Pours a cola brown, almost black, with a 1/2 finger mocha brown head which fades slowly leaving a ring around the edge of the glass which eventually fades into a headless pool of flat cola. No lacing. Swirling the glass brings out some alcohol legs.

Smell: Cocoa, vanilla and bourbon dominate with roasted malt, a nice nuttiness, dried fruit, molasses and a hint of alcohol.

Taste: Medium roasted malt, sweet chocolate and a touch of maple syrup up front followed by molasses, vanilla and bourbon in the middle before ending with just a touch of toasted malt, a bit more maple sweetness and a bit of alcohol at the finish. Aftertaste is sweet with just a little bitterness. The alcohol comes through stronger as it warms up.

Mouthfeel: Full-bodied with a decent amount of carbonation. There is a mild alcohol burn as it goes down due to the ABV. 

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. Goes down exceptionally smooth for a beer with an ABV of 11%.

Overall: Excellent beer overall. While its labeled as an American Porter here on BA and as an Imperial Porter by Jackie Os, its really an American Double / Imperial Stout. Whatever you call it, its damn near perfect. I would very highly recommend this one if you get the chance to try it.

Bottle poured into snifter. Appears near black, small brown head. Very oily in the glass...lots of legs! Aromas of oak, maple syrup, bitter chocolate and anise. Taste is nicely balanced with a silky mouthfeel. Bitter chocolate with toffee, oats with maple syrup...anise and vanilla...wet oak and a warming bourbon! Finish lingers and clings to the palate. Awesome stuff!!

Bottle:
Nearly black with a small beige head.
Smoky, maple and chocolate scent...sweet bourbon.
Maple syrup, chocolate malt, dark, roasty, sweet bourbon flavour.
Thick and sweet, nicely hidden alcohol....
Excellent.

Bottle. Bourbon, maple syrup, and chocolate malt aroma. Black with small tan head. Sweet maple syrup, bourbon, milk chocolate malt, and lightly bitter herbal flavor. Maple mellows out the bourbon nicely. Excellent.
Bottle thanks to Collin, thanks man! Light barrel and sweet and thick. Very little roast. Alcohol present, maple sweetness adds a layer throughout the taste
UPDATED: SEP 14, 2015 Bottle..Pour is dark black with a tan head..Nose is bourbon, spice, chocolate, maple, spice..Taste is maple, chocolate, spice, sweetness, oak, roast, vanillin, nutty..amazing

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours black with a quickly-dissipating, off-white head. The aroma is a tapestry of chocolate crème, fudge, molasses, maple syrup and vanilla. Full-bodied and silky with laid-back carbonation. The roasty flavor offers sweet maple syrup, dark chocolate and a light component of sticky vanilla beans. Warming, nourishing finish. Thanks to darkguardian for sharing this world class beer!

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2015 bottle - Pitch black semi thick pour with basically no head. Nose is booze soaked vanilla beans with faint maple. Taste follows the nose with a touch of maple sweetness in the finish. Lacks body but so do a lot of porters.  Very well done but I was left wanting and expecting more from given the hype machine on this one.

Great inviting aroma of chocolate and the right amount of bourbon. On aroma alone, this is fantastic. Mouthfeel is great as well. Thick and velvety with a decent carbonation. Somewhat viscous feeling. Flavor is very good, if plain. Nothing stands here out as unique and ninjas trouble finding the maple. However, the bourbon is very well integrated and the whole beer has a certain finesse, confidence, and ease of execution. Don't expect anything mind blowing here, but be satisfied with something exceptionally crafted.

Bottle thanks to JStax ! Pours a thick viscous burnt umber color with a finger of khaki foam. Silky boozy maple goodness right here. Fresh baked brownies, maple syrup, soft caramel, layers of cocoa powder, nutty bourbon hints of roast and a viscous body. Mouthcoating and delicious !

This one poured an almost jet black with a beige head. Aroma was of lots of soft Bourbon, oak, chocolate fudge cake, roasted grain. Flavor was similar, a bit on the sweet side, chocolatey and good barrel character. All the maple has fermented out but still tasty stuff.
Black base yields minimal head, if any. Rich and decadent. Maple and bourbon in spades. Low carb, lacks body, but man that's tasty.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06 pours opaque black. Nose stale Bourbon and cheese, some earthy like mushroom. Taste Bourbon, maple, sweet malt, tiny bit of vanilla. Nice thick mouth feel. For some reason, the nose just rubbed me the wrong way.
Almost black, beige lacing. Nutty, yeasty, roasted malt, char, a little chocolate. Mild sweetness, then bitter coffee. Long bitter finish
Bottle shared by Darkguardian. Dark brown pour with an off white head. Big maple syrup bouquet. All kinds of caramel malts and maple syrup. A bit one dimensional. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle from the brewery via Michael K. Aroma maple, dark chocolate, brown sugar. Dark dried fruit, very nice, pulled pork, soy sauce. Body light but boozy finish total maple, painting my goddamn mouth with smoke and maple.

Bottle thanks to Peter. Nose is very mild all around. Slight sugar crust. Pour is pitch black. Small had. Taste is much better, very sugary, chocolate, slight burnt sugar, caramel. 🍻 Pretty good but u think I like apparition better.

Bottle from Joe. Big time thanks! Pours dark brown as it comes out of the bottle, but settles pretty pitch black in the glass with a very small, quickly receding dark brown head. Awesome and super sweet aroma of chocolate and bourbon, vanilla, roasted marshmallow, sweet maple, caramel, toffee. Flavor is a beautiful meld of sweet vanilla and bourbon, oak, more bourbon, some caramel, marshmallow, extra sweetness that I assume is maple, though that flavor is not particularly present. The bourbon flavors are very mellow here, despite it having a body very much on the thinner side for being barrel aged. Its so well integrated, though, that it doesnt really take away much from the beer. Medium prickle on the carbonation, long finish of vanilla, caramel, oak, and bourbon. Really, really nice. Still do wish it had a bit more body. But the flavors meld so nicely.

Draft at Jackie-Os on the brewpub side. Pours a deep brown with a small tan head that leaves a ring and some film atop the beer. Plenty of maple here, with vanilla, chocolate, brown sugar, oak, earth, tobacco, and a little toast and roast. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet mouthfeel that coats before drying. Just a wee bit too sweet on the nose for me, but otherwise this is pretty darn good. Now I have to open a bottle at home.

Pours jet black with a thin mocha head. Aroma of chocolate, maple, brown sugar, molasses, Bourbon, vanilla and oak. Taste is sweet maple, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla and oak. Smooth, yet a bit thin. Still delicious, just wish there was more body.

Bottle. Pours black color with a moderate frothy brown head that slowly diminished with good lacing. Heavy toasted dark chocolate, vanilla, wood and bourbon aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Heavy roasted malt bourbon sweet flavor with a medium to heavy bourbon sweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout porter.

Draft at Jackie os. Pours dark brown to black in color with a thin beige film. The aroma and flavor have maple syrup, dark chocolate, roast, bourbon, vanilla, some wood, some alcohol is present but is mostly warming, big flavors like an imperial stout, I am a fan of this.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Maple syrup, roasted, stout aromas. Sweet maple syrup flavors, spice, chocolate flavors.

Bottle thanks to George. Pours a cloudy brown with beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong maple, bourbon, wood, roast, chocolate. Thick mouthfeel with nice roasted malt, dark chocolate, sweet finish, very impressive.

Bottle from Savor Growl (I think). Black pour with a tan head that dissipates quickly leaving a ring. Aroma of maple, bourbon, roasted malt, light smoke, dark fruit, chocolate - lots going on. Tastes are dark chocolate, sweet syrupy maple, caramel - not a lot of the bourbon, which is good by my tastes. Really covers the alcohol well - only a background warmth. Pricey, but nice sipper.

375ml bottle, 2014 vintage. Served in a DFH snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with about a half inch tan head that fizzled away quickly. Theres a small amount of lacing. Aroma is amazing, the brew smells like maple, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, and roasted malt. The taste is mostly sweet and mapley. It tastes like maple, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, roasted malt, and a bit of dark fruit. Mouthfeel/body is full, its coating and creamy with low/moderate carbonation. The 11% ABV is well hidden in this brew, it doesnt seem like Im drinking something that strong at all! This is definitely one of the best beers Ive drank in a while. Hopefully theyre aging more of this down in Athens right now, because it would be a shame if this was just a one time brew. Definitely recommended if you can get some! $11.99 a bottle.

Bottle from Blacklick Wine & Spirits. Black pour with a medium light brown head. Aroma of bourbon, molasses, chocolate, dark fruit and maple. Malty flavor with maple, caramel and bourbon accents before a sweet chocolate finish.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2015 12.7oz bottle. Big thanks to jstax for leaving this one for me! Man, after reading the deScription on the bottle and seeming the label (the most Jackie-Os-est label for distro yet), I have to say I am extremely excited for this beer. Pretty much black color. Thin ring of off-white / khaki head, pretty much minimal. A couple dots of lace. Nose and flavor have a little more raw graininess than expected. Dark chocolate, chocolate syrup. Some maple syrup. Moderate bitter taste. Moderate sweet... But what dominates is the big alcohol bite. Theres a moderate alcohol burn on this, and a sort of boozy spiciness in the finish. Bigger body. Smooth, kind of crisp lighter carbonation. Light slick finish. Nice chewiness to the texture. Alright stuff, in the end... Just unfortunately much boozier than expected. An unnecessary burn that dominates the palate. Beyond that, theres a nice maple / dark chocolate mild roast flavor to it. Bourbon kind of harshes the overall vibe, though. I wanted to love this, but Im a little let down. Maybe this will get better with age? I thought it would be magical enough to chief on my own, but I regret now not sharing it. A little more difficult to drink than expected. 8/3/6/4/13 Update, 11/6/15: 2015 Bottle shared with friends. Near-black color. thin ring of khaki head. Some loose bits of lace. Great maple, dark chocolate, some mild roast malt coffee notes. Bit of bourbon vanilla, big oak. Definitely a big bourbon note, but not as harsh as I remember, nor sweet. Maybe better to share, now. Moderate to bigger sweet taste, but not cloying at all. Good moderate bitter too, but not like an imperial stout. More creamy, kind of milky. Certainly in imperial porter territory. Bigger body, kind of chewy. Light carbonation. More dry finish. Delicious one to share. I think I went for more sips than others.

Bottle pour opened the day it was bottled. Pours a thick, oily black with no head. The aroma is big, sweet maple syrup, bourbon sweetness, and some root beer notes as well. The taste is big sweetness. Very tasty stuff. Moderate to low carbonation. Awesome beer!
